* Returns the string representation of the current object.
* Duke is a bot which helps to record things which people want to remember.
* @param filepath File path where saved data is stored.
* The unique exceptions thrown by Duke.
* Constructor for DukeException for an invalid input.
this.description = "☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(";
* Constructor for DukeException for a missing task descriptor.
* @param task The task which is missing a descriptor.
this.description = " ☹ OOPS!!! The description of a " + task + " cannot be empty.";
* Returns the description of this DukeException.

* The Storage class contains the methods required to load from
* and save to the save file.
* @param filepath Filepath of the save file.
* Creates a save file at filepath.
* Loads from the save file at filepath.
* @return Tasks saved in the save file.
* Writes to the save file based off a given TaskList list.
* @param list The given TaskList used to write to the save file.

* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task. "X" if the task is done,
* and " " if it is not done.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the string representation of the object.
* The TaskList class contains the list of tasks used in Duke.
* Constructor for TaskList from a given ArrayList.
* @param list The given ArrayList containing a number of Task objects.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Deletes the Task at index from the TaskList.
* @param index The position of the Task to be deleted.

* @param index The position of the Task to be unmarked.

* The Todo class represents a todo task.
* Returns the string representation of the current object.
* The Ui class handles most of the messages shown to the user.
* Message shown when save file is not found.
System.out.println("No save file to load from");
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Duke" + "\n" + "What can I do for you?");
* Message shown when user stops using Duke.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Message shown when a task is deleted.
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:" + "\n" + "\t" + task.toString());
* Message shown when a task is marked.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:" + "\n" + "\t" + task.toString());
* Message shown when a task is unmarked.
System.out.println("Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:" + "\n" + "\t" + task.toString());
* Message shown when a task is added.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:" + "\n\t" + task.toString());
* Message shown when the number of tasks has to be shown to the user.
* @param numOfTasks Number of tasks left in the list.
System.out.println("Now you have " + numOfTasks + " tasks in the list.");
